snippet: Manning, who is in the last year of his current Giants contract, with a base salary of $17 million, said that neither he nor his agent had made such a demand.
abstract: New York Giants quarterback Eli Manning, who is in midst of negotiations as his contract is set to expire, disputes reports that he wants to be NFL's highest-paid player.
lead_paragraph: Manning, who is in the last year of his current Giants contract, with a base salary of $17 million, said that neither he nor his agent had made such a demand.

headline.main: Eli Manning Disputes Report That He Wants to Be N.F.L.’s Highest-Paid Player
headline.print_headline: Eli Manning Denies Report That He Wants Richest Deal
